intro: Sclerolobium paniculatum var. rubiginosum, commonly known as the red-stemmed acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers that appear in panicles. The plant has a woody stem with a reddish or brownish hue, which gives it its common name. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. The species is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
